Entry.Title: Police officers fall ill after visiting home of British chemical weapon expert who appears on Russia Today
Entry.Description: Dr Chris Busby previously claimed Britain may be behind Sailsbury poisoning

Entry.Title: Man lambasts Arriva Trains Wales after being charged 10% of cash found in his lost wallet
Entry.Description: Company also charges £3 fee for lost walking sticks

Entry.Title: Salisbury attack: Russian spies 'arrested on way to Swiss lab testing novichok samples'
Entry.Description: The spies, who are not the same men suspected of attacking Sergei Skripal, were sent back to Russia in the spring

Entry.Title: Prison strike: Government seeks court injunction to stop officers walking out over 'unprecedented' wave of violence
Entry.Description: 'I'm fed up of hearing of my members receiving smashed eye sockets, broken arms, broken legs... enough is enough', says jail staff union leader

Entry.Title: No-deal Brexit: UK-made cars will not be 'valid for sale' in EU, government document admits
Entry.Description: Warning comes just two days after the boss of Jaguar Land Rover attacked Theresa May's Brexit strategy

Entry.Title: Man raised money for Lee Rigby's son then spent it on making music single
Entry.Description: Lorry driver Gary Gardner claims track flopped because of bad weather

Entry.Title: Afghan father who sought refuge in UK 'shot dead by Taliban' after being deported by Home Office
Entry.Description: Exclusive: Zainadin Fazlie, father of four British-born children, forced to return to Afghanistan after 16 years in UK despite threats to his life - and killed two years later

Entry.Title: Theresa May should 'seal deal' with Brexit and then stand down, says former policy adviser
Entry.Description: 'She deserves the chance to honour her promise and deliver our departure from the European Union on March 29. But the shape of our future must be forged by a new leader'

Entry.Title: JLS star Oritse Williams charged with raping fan in Wolverhampton hotel room
Entry.Description: Friend also charged with sexual assault in connection with incident following gig in the city

Entry.Title: No-deal Brexit could lead to financial crisis as bad as 2008, warns Bank of England chief Mark Carney
Entry.Description: Governor's bleak prognosis comes as France says it could halt flights and Eurostar trains from UK if no Brexit agreement is reached

Entry.Title: Fitness trackers and genetic tests will send 'worried well into hyperdrive', warn surgeons as health secretary pledges tech push
Entry.Description: Royal College of Surgeons commission warns more information from wearable tech and cancer risk tests will cause anxiety and drive demand unless NHS adapts

Entry.Title: Doctors' inconsistent meningitis advice putting children at risk, charity warns
Entry.Description: Report details stories of 134 parents whose children had bacterial meningitis. Three-quarters were given inappropriate reassurances and in 23 cases children died

Entry.Title: Labour antisemitism row was created by Israel to distract from 'atrocities', trade union boss suggests
Entry.Description: PCS leader Mark Serwotka claims there is 'something sinister going on' behind 'the most systematic attempt' to shut down criticism of Israel

Entry.Title: Knife crime offences rise to highest level since 2010 in England and Wales
Entry.Description: Murder detectives warn that investigations are being made harder by social media

Entry.Title: No-deal Brexit: Britons face wide-ranging travel chaos, latest government advice papers reveal
Entry.Description: Driving licences may no longer be valid in the EU – while trains and planes could be barred

Entry.Title: Salisbury novichok attack: The most implausible claims made by Russian men accused of attempted assassination of Sergei Skripal
Entry.Description: Russians say their visit to Britain 'wasn't a business trip' but they arrived on business visas

Entry.Title: NHS summer crisis 'worst on record' as health service fails to meet cancer referral target
Entry.Description: Health experts express serious concern after number of patients waiting more than 12 hours in A&E also reaches record high

Entry.Title: Tory MEPs ordered to distance themselves from Hungary's far-right Viktor Orban after vote controversy
Entry.Description: Religious groups accused the party of 'giving bigotry a free pass' in European Parliament vote

Entry.Title: Tories are backing far-right Viktor Orban to boost Theresa May's Brexit plans, says Muslim Council of Britain
Entry.Description: The MCB's intervention follows a similar one from the Board of Deputies of British Jews criticising the Conservatives' vote

Entry.Title: Salisbury attack: Russian novichok suspects deny involvement in poisoning, insisting they were in town to see 'famous' cathedral
Entry.Description: It was all about Salisbury Cathedral's 123m spire, suspects claim despite arriving in Britain on business visas

Entry.Title: Government pledge to give Calais children right to remain in UK branded 'unfair and arbitrary'
Entry.Description: Campaigners welcome new form of leave for minors but critics say offer is 'limited'

Entry.Title: Grenfell Tower inquiry hears trapped residents were never told to evacuate, even after order was given
Entry.Description: Control room did not re-contact 999 callers telling them to get out

Entry.Title: Was SAS man's 'great untold true story of the Cold War' actually lifted from pages of spy fiction?
Entry.Description: Publisher hits back at claims Tom Shore's 'true story' 'Pilgrim Spy' seems to mirror fictional thriller 'Quiller KGB', with chunks of Wikipedia apparently lifted for background context

Entry.Title: Brexit - as it happened: Government publishes tranche of documents on no-deal 'risks', including roaming charges and driving licences
Entry.Description: Brexit secretary Dominic Raab has published the second tranche of technical notes, outlining the government's preparations for crashing out of the EU without a deal.

Entry.Title: UK will be kicked out of EU programme that keeps it safe from space debris hurtling towards Earth in event of no-deal Brexit, government warns
Entry.Description: Programme would be responsible for warning the country if a satellite was dropping towards the Earth

Entry.Title: Number of white people arrested for terror offences outstrip any other single ethnic group, new figures show
Entry.Description: Number of terror arrests falls by 22% overall but police say there has been no decrease in threat

Entry.Title: Terrible weather then framed for chemical assassination: two Russian murderers and the holiday from hell
Entry.Description: When it comes to bad luck on holiday, no one comes close to the unlucky tourists Ruslan Boshirov and Alexander Petrov

Entry.Title: Theresa May lashes out at 'blatant' lies in interview with Russian novichok suspects
Entry.Description: The prime minister said claims made by the men are 'offensive' to the people hurt in the chemical weapons incident

Entry.Title: Badger cull expanded to 11 new sites despite cruelty claims
Entry.Description: Government claims progress in fight against TB but campaigners call for 'medicine, not marksmen'

Entry.Title: Three critically endangered hen harriers disappear in 'suspicious circumstances', says RSPB
Entry.Description: Birds of prey 'vanish without a trace' within months of hatching, raising suspicions of illegal killing

Entry.Title: Abortion clinic 'buffer zones' plan to stop protesters rejected by the government in surprise move
Entry.Description: Former home secretary Amber Rudd said it was 'unacceptable' that anyone should feel intimidated at an abortion clinic

Entry.Title: Madeleine McCann: Detectives ask UK government for six months' further funding for investigation
Entry.Description: Funding for Scotland Yard's Operation Grange due to run out at end of month

Entry.Title: Eurostar will not run if there is a no-deal Brexit, French Europe minister warns
Entry.Description: Alarm raised one week after secret Treasury document acknowledged questions about 'rail access to the EU'

Entry.Title: British people spend over £680 million every year fixing broken phone screens, survey claims
Entry.Description: Research shows majority of Britons would prefer new phone which is reliable and resistant over one with improved hardware

Entry.Title: UK driving licences 'may no longer be valid in EU' in event of no-deal Brexit, government admits
Entry.Description: Lorry drivers and holidaymakers may be forced to obtain permits for different countries

Entry.Title: Man's body found in graveyard in 'unexplained' circumstances
Entry.Description: Bouquets of flowers mark the scene

Entry.Title: HMP Bedford: prison watchdog issues fourth 'urgent notice' on jails in space of nine months
Entry.Description: Ministers told to take urgent action after inspectors warn 'there could all too easily be complete breakdown in order and discipline'

Entry.Title: M5 crash: Motorway closed after two killed and four injured as lorry and cars collide
Entry.Description: Lengthy delays after fatal accident on one of UK's busiest motorways

Entry.Title: Conservatives condemned by British Jewish leaders after MEPs vote to defend Hungary's far-right Orban government
Entry.Description: The organisation has said the Conservative support for Mr Orban's authoritarian regime is 'very concerning'

Entry.Title: UK mass surveillance programme violates human rights, European court rules
Entry.Description: Liberty hails 'major victory for the rights and freedom of people'

Entry.Title: Yom Kippur 2018: What you need to know about the holiest day of the Jewish year
Entry.Description: Day of Atonement closes Ten Days of Repentance after Rosh Hashanah

Entry.Title: Westminster attack inquest: Tourist boat didn't try to rescue woman drowning in Thames, thinking she was already dead
Entry.Description: 'There was nothing stopping her being lifted by a matter of inches to see if she was alive,' says barrister

Entry.Title: How Brexit has revived controversy over the Elgin Marbles in Britain
Entry.Description: The Parthenon Sculptures have been the subject of debate for more than 200 years. With Theresa May scurrying around the EU trying to deliver Brexit, Greece is quite right to probe the possibility of bringing the treasures home

Entry.Title: Woman drove ex-boyfriend to kill her lover by sending photo of her having sex with him

Entry.Title: Woman who sent ex-partner picture of sex act with new lover convicted after he took murderous revenge

Entry.Title: Four-year-old British girl with cerebral palsy walks to school after specialist treatment in US
Entry.Description: Emmy King started school this week following operation and intensive physiotherapy

Entry.Title: Drunk driver flees crash as members of public try to pull him from wrecked car
Entry.Description: Emilio Gates 'clearly unsteady on his feet' at time of incident

Entry.Title: Boy forced into 'roundabout of death' playground stunt left with serious head injuries
Entry.Description: Mother of 11-year-old says her child 'looked like the elephant man', after incident 'inspired by popular YouTube video'

Entry.Title: Jo Swinson makes history by bringing her baby into Commons chamber for proxy voting debate
Entry.Description: Liberal Democrat deputy leader says taking 11-week-old son into chamber seemed 'natural thing to do'

Entry.Title: Elected police and crime commissioners can be 'absolutely bleeding hopeless', report told
Entry.Description: Officers tell researchers Coalition government changes left 'bonkers' structure of British policing

Entry.Title: Man refused UK visa to visit newborn grandson because he did not send photo of 1975 wedding
Entry.Description: Exclusive: Stepan Polyakov denied entry to Britain despite providing copy of marriage certificate

Entry.Description: Campaigners argued the watchdog failed in its duty to regulate the referendum process

Entry.Title: Dwarf wrestlers vent anger at British charity after protests see tour events cancelled
Entry.Description: 'We urge councils and people: Do not discriminate against people born with dwarfism'

Entry.Title: Birmingham shooting: Teenage girl and woman shot in 'targeted attack' in Sheldon
Entry.Description: Police launch inquiry, but no arrests yet made

Entry.Title: Protest by prison staff over violence and safety concerns called off after government seeks court injunction
Entry.Description: General secretary of Prison Officers Association says he is 'confident a deal is a deal' after prison service 'backed down' over seeking injunction against walk-out

Entry.Title: Homeless man found dead in Middlesbrough graveyard was sprayed in paint attack days earlier
Entry.Description: 'This is how we deal with beggars on the street', voice says in video of assault

Entry.Title: Windrush: Home Office offered bonuses to private firm that detained and removed citizens
Entry.Description: Documents suggest department could be withholding crucial evidence, about the wrongful removals and deportations, from an inquiry into the scandal

Entry.Title: Three carjackers convicted of 'evil' acid attack on brain-damaged boxer Michael Watson
Entry.Description: Former world title challenger forced to hang on 'for dear life' as he was dragged 500 yards along road
